citeinfo.origin: Comprehensive Coastal Inventory, Virginia Institute of Marine Science
citeinfo.title: Lynnhaven Bay, Virginia - Access Structures 2007

descript.abstract: Shoreline Situation Reports (SSR) were first generated by VIMS in the 1970s to report the condition and status of the shore lands. The SSR series were published in hardcopy on a county by county basis for each of the Tidewater Virginia localities. The reports were intended to assist planners, managers, and regulators in decisions pertaining to management of coastal areas and natural resources therein. This report continues the process which updates and expands earlier reports. Data collected describes conditions in the immediate riparian zone, the bank, and along the shore.
descript.purpose: To inventory Virginia's tidal shoreline conditions
descript.supplinf: There are three shape files that contain the above information. This coverage, lynn_astru (Lynnhaven Bay access structures for the year 2006-2007), is a point coverage with locations of docks, boathouses, outfalls, and ramps both public and private. The attributes are further described in the Entity and Attribute Information section below.

timeperd.current: Ground condition at time of survey

idinfo.useconst: These data should not be used for jurisdictional permit determinations beyond providing general shoreline condition or status information. These data have not been surveyed to property boundaries.
idinfo.datacred: Collection of the data would not be possible without the cooperation of VIMS Vessel Center. The following CCI staff participated in the data collection and processing: Marcia Berman, Harry Berquist, Sharon Killeen, Karinna Nunez, Tami Rudnicky, and Dan Schatt.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.0.1324

attracc.attraccr: The attributes were compared to original GPS data logs for accuracy. Errors were corrected where noted.

dataqual.logic: Chain-node topology present. Point coverage was built for points.
dataqual.complete: All Lynnhaven Bay shoreline that has a minimum depth of 2 feet at mean low water was surveyed. Areas inaccessible by boat have been remotely surveyed by looking at digital aerial imagery.

horizpa.horizpar: Shoreline access structures were recorded with a GPS unit as the boat moved along the shoreline. Point structures were aligned with structures on the images. Positional accuracy for data that has been corrected with imagery is 2 meters (equivalent to image resolution). Accuracy was determined by comparing digitally processed data locations to onsite GPS ground surveys collected at random.

srcinfo.srccontr: Serves as a background image in the map portfolios. Used to accurately position access structures.

procstep.procdesc: Data was collected by a two-person field crew (both collecting data and one driving the boat) using hand held Trimble GeoExplorers and GeoXT GPS Units, While navigating along the shoreline. The boat handler collects the hardened structures and the access structures (docks/piers, boathouses, outfalls, and public and private ramps). The other person is collecting the land use/ land cover data. Point features were surveyed with a 5 second observation recorded at 1 reading/second.

Data from the GPS units were postprocessed on a PC with Trimble Pathfinder Office software. Postprocessing included differential correction using CORS (Continuous Operating Reference Stations) data. Corrected data is converted into ArcInfo shapefiles for further processing in ArcMap.
Lynnhaven Bay shoreline was extracted from the VBMP digital terrain model (DTM). The shoreline was converted to an ArcInfo coverage and projected from Virginia State Plane to UTM zone 18.

ArcMap 9.2 software on a PC was used to attribute the base shoreline. Boat-track points and arcs, VBMP imagery, and the base shoreline were displayed in ArcMap. Points were placed on the shoreline perpendicular to the boat-track data and the spatial adjustment attribute transfer tool was used to transfer boat-track data to the shoreline. VBMP imagery provided additional information for placement of features. Shape files were visually checked for attribute transfer accuracy between boat-track and shoreline.

Six 1:12,000 scale plates were created for the Lynnhaven Bay SSR. Each plate has 4 associated maps: riparian land use, bank and buffer conditions, shoreline features and natural buffers. VBMP imagery is displayed in the background to provide users with additional information. Maps are created using ArcMap software.
Data recieved a final check in hard copy map format. Changes were made as necessary to data.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Areas inaccessible by boat which were remotely coded.

distinfo.distliab: The Comprehensive Coastal Inventory Program (CCI) at VIMS performs a service by distributing data generated by either CCI or public agencies which offer data without restrictions or charge. CCI assumes no responsibility for data accuracy or precision, metadata completeness or correctness for digital information. CCI assumes no liability for misuse of any data which may arise as a result of any alteration, conversion, or combination with other data sources. As well, the timeliness and scale of these products must be considered when evaluating appropriate use.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
